rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Anticipated performance
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: The conference call will include forward-looking statements regarding Pfizer's anticipated performance, including financial guidance, product pipeline developments, and responses to COVID-19. These statements are subject to substantial risks and uncertainties, such as clinical trial outcomes, regulatory success, and market dynamics. Investors should be aware of the inherent uncertainties and the potential for actual results to differ materially from projections.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Certain financial measures
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: Certain financial measures discussed may not adhere to U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). Investors should refer to specific disclosures regarding non-GAAP financial measures provided in Pfizer's materials, understanding that these measures may not be directly comparable to GAAP measures and should not be viewed as substitutes for them.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Audience-and-Intent
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: The discussions and presentations are tailored for the investor community, focusing on financial performance and strategic outlook. They are not intended to influence healthcare prescribing decisions or promote specific products. Cross-trial comparisons and anticipated data should be interpreted cautiously due to potential confounding factors.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Collaborations-and-Commercial-Rights
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: Pfizer's products and candidates discussed may involve collaborations with other companies, with Pfizer's rights varying by market. This underscores the complexity of Pfizer's commercialization strategies and highlights the importance of understanding market-specific agreements and partnerships.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Maximize performance of our new products
Breakthroughs that change patientsâ€™ lives
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: >119M Patients Impacted YTD Q1 2024 with our medicines and vaccines

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Deliver the next wave of pipeline innovation
Expand margins by realigning our cost base
Allocate capital to enhance shareholder value
2030 Oncology Goals
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: Double # of patients treated, Increase # of blockbuster medicines from 5 to 8+, Drive 10x increase in proportion of revenue from biologics

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Deliver Next Wave of Pipeline Innovation
Excellent Progress in Oncology
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: Three pivotal Phase 3 study starts in Q1 2024: Atirmociclib selective CDK4 inhibitor, Sigvotatug vedotin integrin-beta-6-directed ADC, ELREXFIO 4th Phase 3 trial in multiple myeloma

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Protect / Grow Core Franchises and Key Blockbusters
Revenues
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: $14.9B (19)% op $12.5B1 11% op Excluding Comirnaty and Paxlovid, op growth primarily driven by legacy Seagen, Vyndaqel family, Eliquis, Abrysvo and Prevnar family, partially offset by lower revenues for Oncology biosimilars in U.S., Sulperazon in ex-U.S. and Ibrance

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Adjusted Cost of Sales
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: $3.0B (34)% op 20.4%5.3 ppts Decrease in COS% driven primarily by favorable changes in sales mix, including lower sales of Comirnaty2 and, to a much lesser extent, the impact of final adjustment to Paxlovid revenue reversal recorded in Q4 2023

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Adjusted SIA Expenses
rdf:Description.rdfs:Description: $3.5B 3% op Primarily driven by an increase in marketing and promotional expenses for recently acquired and launched products, partially offset by a decrease in marketing and promotional expenses for Paxlovid and Comirnaty
